data.text: Looking for a Robust Touring Wheel for a Trip Through NC500

Looking to up grade my endurance wheels ready for a self supported trip round NC500. Concerned weights may be too much for current wheels, looking for robust gravel/ touring wheels that roll well. Any recommendations?
Look at HUNT wheels !
data.author: Peter Couttie

data.text:
I'm sure Spa can help https://www.spacycles.co.uk/
Touring Specialist | Spa Cycles
spacycles.co.uk
data.author: Dave Ansell

data.text: Hi Alan I'm off to do the NC500 solo trip at the end of May. When are you hoping to be up there?🙂
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: starting 6 June hopefully. Lots of day light at that time of year. Looking at 6 days to get round.
data.author: Alan Fletcher

data.text: I'm up on the 20th May have allowed 7 days but more than likely do it in six just thought the extra day would take the pressure off if hit with bad weather etc. Days pretty long as well so will just cycle till I have had enough🙂 good luck and enjoy🙂👍
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: please let us know how you get on I’ve heard the route can be very busy with cars?
data.author: Dave Ansell

data.text: yes in some parts, I would suggest missing out the A9 as much as possible, I also intend to hit the Belac na Ba very early in the morning before the camper vans wake up😁
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: I'm going up to John O Groats camping over night then doubling back on my route to Melvic h then cutting across country to Helmsdale missing out a large chunk of the A9 around the Black Isle and back to Inverness
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: thanks enjoy!
data.author: Dave Ansell

data.text: I did a tour around there a few years ago it’s beautiful and make sure it’s not wet and very windy on Bealach Na ba I had an epic fail there!
data.author: Dave Ansell

data.text: I'll take your sound advice re Belach Na Ba thank you😁🙂
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: my first day is a short one to Loch Carron then early start up and over the big hill (😁) then a full English/Scottish breakfast in Applecross then onwards!!!
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: are you going clockwise
data.author: Alan Fletcher

data.text: Yes indeed
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: I know some people say you should do it anti clockwise and save the best till last🙂
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: more likely to get a head wind coming down the west coast. Let us know how you get on, where you stay, any problems getting supplies etc
data.author: Alan Fletcher

data.text: Yes of course will do🙂 I'm taking some of these dehydrated meals as emergency rations just in case I get caught out with shops shut etc. Otherwise will pick up food as I go around. As for accommodation apart from my B&B in Inverness I'm only checking in to one hotel at Dundonnell apart from that wild camping and maybe some camp sites🙂👍
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: Cool. We intent to wild camp as well
data.author: Alan Fletcher

data.text: I have to admit was going to B&B it all the way round but I like the idea of the freedom that wild camping gives you which also takes away the "pressure" of a schedule to keep to. As I said before if it's a nice day it gives me the freedom to cycle further on that particular day if I want to and pitch when I have had enough🙂👍
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: Hunt make excellent wheels
data.author: Steve Lindley

data.text: Find a reputable LBS and get them to make you as set. Hope RS4 Hubs, Sapim Spokes, DT Swiss R540 rims.
data.author: Andrew Weaver

data.text: Hi , give a shout👍
data.author: Dave Robinson

data.text: My Hunts have just needed a freehub - only done about 2k miles including just one ride with weight (bumpy ride down Bath canal path in Feb)Repairer said second pair of Hunts in that week with the same problem - I love the wheels and were recommended them but might be wise to check with Hunt in case they offer a heavier duty hub for bikepacking.
data.author: IJ Owly McGee
